text: was an island province of Japan in the area of Nagasaki Prefecture near the island of Kyūshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Iki" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 379. The province is also known as . The province was Iki Island. ==History== In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. Maps of Japan and Iki Province were reformed in the 1870s.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. ==Shrines and Temples== Amanotanagao jinja was the chief Shinto shrine (ichinomiya) of Iki. "Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 3 ; retrieved 2012-1-18. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan ==References== ==Other websites == * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Former provinces of Japan Category:Nagasaki Prefecture
title: Iki Province
